definition: Ceaseless pain (Sanskrit: Avici), one of the Buddhist hells/fig. hell/hell on earth
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
to take refuge in religious life
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
to run off the track/to step out of line/to overstep the bounds of propriety
